quote.quotepara: I have the following code to display my XML DOM document.
I need to fix following things in this
1. I always get an XML header by default , is there an option to suppress this ?

body.para: the domwriter always produces xml output that will be parsed again by a dom parser without error. Since the xml header is mandatory by standard, it is always written out.

quote.quotepara: 2. If I delete and add new nodes it displays a blank line and indentation of the XML gets corrupted. Could any of you please throw some light on this?

body.para: Indention iteself consists of xml nodes (text nodes). If you manipulate the dom tree and don't take care of the so called, ignorable whitespaces, you surely will damage the previous indention.

You can switch on the 'pretty printing' feature (instead of switching it off), in order to have indented xml output. Maybe you want to try my alternative way of pretty pinting (see the mailing list archives, msg-id <200503301757.34859.aweiss@informatik.hu-berlin.de>).
NB: this transcode method will become deprecated, soon. You'd better use XMLCh tempStr[3] = {chLatin_L, chLatin_S, chNull};
